intro: Phaca arnottiana, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its long, narrow leaves that can grow up to several meters in length. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in coastal and wetland areas. Phaca arnottiana has been used traditionally by Māori for its strong, fibrous leaves in the making of clothing and other crafts.
